metadata.title: CVE-2019-10269 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
BWA (aka Burrow-Wheeler Aligner) before 2019-01-23 has a stack-based bufferoverflow in the bns_restore function in bntseq.c via a long sequence namein a .alt file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10269` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bwa - 0.7.17-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bwa package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.7.17-3').
